universum.studios.android.officium.account

Class UserAccountManager<A extends UserAccount>

  • java.lang.Object
    • universum.studios.android.officium.account.UserAccountManager<A>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - Type of the user account that will be managed by the UserAccountManager subclass.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SingleUserAccountManager

    public abstract class UserAccountManager<A extends UserAccount>
extends Object
    Wrapper for AccountManager that can be used to simplify management of an Android application accounts. Each instance of UserAccountManager can manage accounts only of a single type that is specified during initialization via UserAccountManager(Context, String) constructor. UserAccountManager can be used for both creation and deletion of Android accounts via createAccount(UserAccount) and deleteAccount(UserAccount) or via theirs asynchronous relatives createAccountAsync(UserAccount) and deleteAccountAsync(UserAccount).

    This manager also provides API methods to store and peek authentication tokens for a specific account via setAccountAuthToken(Account, String, String) and peekAccountAuthToken(Account, String) along with account's password management via setAccountPassword(Account, String) and getAccountPassword(Account). Data for a specific account can be stored either as single values via setAccountData(Account, String, String) or as data Bundle via setAccountDataBundle(Account, Bundle) which is basically bulk method for the single value storing method. Stored account data can be than obtained via getAccountData(Account, String) or via getAccountDataBundle(Account, String...).

    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  UserAccountManager.AccountWatcher<A extends UserAccount>
      Watcher that may be used to listen for callbacks fired whenever a new Android Account is created or deleted asynchronously for its associated UserAccount.

      Type of accounts that can be managed by this manager.

      Context used to access mManager and other needed application data about accounts.

      Value for Android permission to GET accounts.

      Value for Android permission to MANAGE accounts.

      • setKeyEncrypto

        public final void setKeyEncrypto(@Nullable
                                 universum.studios.android.crypto.Encrypto encrypto)
        Sets an implementation of Encrypto that should be used by this account manager to perform account data keys encryption operation.
        Parameters:
        encrypto - The desired encrypto implementation. May be null to not perform keys encryption.
        See Also:
        setDataCrypto(Crypto)

      • setDataCrypto

        public final void setDataCrypto(@Nullable
                                universum.studios.android.crypto.Crypto crypto)
        Sets an implementation of Crypto that should be used by this account manager to perform account data encryption/decryption operations.

        Note, that if specified, the provided crypto will be also used for password encryption/decryption operations.

        Parameters:
        crypto - The desired crypto implementation. May be null to not perform data encryption/decryption.
        See Also:
        setKeyEncrypto(Encrypto), setAccountData(Account, String, String), getAccountData(Account, String), getAccountDataBundle(Account, String...)

      • createAccountAsync

        public void createAccountAsync(@NonNull
                               A userAccount)
        Same as createAccount(UserAccount) where creation of the given userAccount will be executed asynchronously using AsyncTask. When the creation process is finished the current AccountWatchers (if any) will be notified through UserAccountManager.AccountWatcher.onAccountCreated(UserAccount) callback.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_GET_ACCOUNTS along with PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permissions.

        Parameters:
        userAccount - The desired user account for which to create a corresponding Android Account.
        See Also:
        registerWatcher(AccountWatcher), deleteAccountAsync(UserAccount)

      • createAccount

        public boolean createAccount(@NonNull
                             A userAccount)
        Creates a new Android Account for the given userAccount.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_GET_ACCOUNTS along with PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permissions.

        Parameters:
        userAccount - The desired user account for which to create the corresponding Android Account.
        Returns:
        True if the account has been created, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        createAccountAsync(UserAccount), deleteAccount(UserAccount), AccountManager.addAccountExplicitly(Account, String, Bundle), AccountManager.setAuthToken(Account, String, String)

      • onCreateAccount

        protected boolean onCreateAccount(@NonNull
                                  A userAccount)
        Invoked whenever createAccount(UserAccount) or createAccountAsync(UserAccount) is called to create new Android Account.

        Note, that this method can be invoked on a background thread.

        Current implementation always returns true.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_GET_ACCOUNTS along with PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permissions.

        Parameters:
        userAccount - The desired user account for which to create the corresponding Android Account.
        Returns:
        True if account has been created, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        onDeleteAccount(UserAccount), AccountManager.addAccountExplicitly(Account, String, Bundle), AccountManager.setAuthToken(Account, String, String)

      • setAccountAuthToken

        public void setAccountAuthToken(@NonNull
                                Account account,
                                @NonNull
                                String authTokenType,
                                @Nullable
                                String authToken)
        Sets an authentication token for the given account with the specified authTokenType.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        account - The account for which to update its authentication token.
        authTokenType - Type of the authentication token to be stored used as key.
        authToken - The desired authentication token to be stored.
        See Also:
        peekAccountAuthToken(Account, String), isAccountAuthenticated(Account, String), AccountManager.setAuthToken(Account, String, String)

      • isAccountAuthenticated

        public boolean isAccountAuthenticated(@NonNull
                                      Account account,
                                      @NonNull
                                      String authTokenType)
        Checks whether the given account is authenticated or not.

        By default the account is considered authenticated if there is stored authentication token for that account with the specified authTokenType.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        account - The account for which to check its authentication state.
        authTokenType - Type of the authentication token used to resolve whether the account is authenticated or not.
        Returns:
        True if there is stored valid authentication token for the account with the specified token type, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setAccountAuthToken(Account, String, String), peekAccountAuthToken(Account, String)

      • peekAccountAuthToken

        @Nullable
public String peekAccountAuthToken(@NonNull
                                              Account account,
                                              @NonNull
                                              String authTokenType)
        Returns the authentication token for the given account stored for the specified authTokenType.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        account - The account for which to peek the requested authentication token.
        authTokenType - Type of the requested authentication token to peek.
        Returns:
        Authentication token or null if there has not been stored token for the requested type yet or the token has been invalidated.
        See Also:
        setAccountAuthToken(Account, String, String), invalidateAccountAuthToken(Account, String), AccountManager.peekAuthToken(Account, String)

      • invalidateAccountAuthToken

        public void invalidateAccountAuthToken(@NonNull
                                       Account account,
                                       @NonNull
                                       String authToken)
        Invalidates the specified authToken for the given account.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_MANAGE_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        account - The account for which to invalidate the authentication token.
        authToken - The token that should be invalidated.
        See Also:
        peekAccountAuthToken(Account, String), AccountManager.invalidateAuthToken(String, String)

      • setAccountPassword

        public void setAccountPassword(@NonNull
                               Account account,
                               @Nullable
                               String password)
        Sets a password for the given account.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        account - The account for which to update its password.
        password - The desired password to be stored.
        See Also:
        getAccountPassword(Account), clearAccountPassword(Account), AccountManager.setPassword(Account, String)

      • getAccountPassword

        @Nullable
public String getAccountPassword(@NonNull
                                            Account account)
        Returns the password for the given account.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        account - The account for which to obtain the requested password.
        Returns:
        Requested password or null if there has not been stored any password for the account yet.
        See Also:
        setAccountPassword(Account, String), clearAccountPassword(Account), AccountManager.getPassword(Account)

      • clearAccountPassword

        public void clearAccountPassword(@NonNull
                                 Account account)

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_MANAGE_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        account - The account for which to clear its password.
        See Also:
        AccountManager.clearPassword(Account)

      • setAccountData

        public void setAccountData(@NonNull
                           Account account,
                           @NonNull
                           String key,
                           @Nullable
                           String value)
        Sets a single data value for the given account with the specified key.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        account - The account for which to update its data.
        key - The key under which will be the desired value stored.
        value - The desired data value to be stored.
        See Also:
        getAccountData(Account, String), setAccountDataBundle(Account, Bundle), AccountManager.setUserData(Account, String, String)

      • getAccountData

        @Nullable
public String getAccountData(@NonNull
                                        Account account,
                                        @NonNull
                                        String key)
        Returns the single data for the given account stored under the specified key.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        account - The account for which to obtain its data.
        key - The key for which to obtain the requested account data.
        Returns:
        Requested account data or null if there are no data stored for the requested key.
        See Also:
        setAccountData(Account, String, String), AccountManager.getUserData(Account, String)

      • setAccountDataBundle

        public void setAccountDataBundle(@NonNull
                                 Account account,
                                 @NonNull
                                 Bundle dataBundle)
        Sets a bundle with data for the given account.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        account - The account for which to update its data bundle.
        dataBundle - Bundle with the desired data.
        See Also:
        getAccountDataBundle(Account, String...), setAccountData(Account, String, String)

      • getAccountDataBundle

        @NonNull
public Bundle getAccountDataBundle(@NonNull
                                             Account account,
                                             @NonNull
                                             String... keys)
        Returns the bundle with data for the given account.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        account - The account for which to obtain its data bundle.
        keys - Set of keys for which to obtain the desired data.
        Returns:
        Bundle with account data for the requested keys. May be empty if the specified keys are also empty.
        See Also:
        setAccountDataBundle(Account, Bundle), getAccountData(Account, String)

      • deleteAccountAsync

        public void deleteAccountAsync(@NonNull
                               A userAccount)
        Same as deleteAccount(UserAccount) where deletion of the given userAccount will be executed asynchronously using AsyncTask. When the deletion process is finished the current AccountWatchers (if any) will be notified through UserAccountManager.AccountWatcher.onAccountDeleted(UserAccount) callback.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_GET_ACCOUNTS along with PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permissions.

        Parameters:
        userAccount - The desired user account for which to delete the corresponding Android Account.
        See Also:
        registerWatcher(AccountWatcher), deleteAccount(UserAccount), createAccountAsync(UserAccount)

      • deleteAccount

        public boolean deleteAccount(@NonNull
                             A userAccount)
        Deletes an existing Android Account for the given userAccount.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_GET_ACCOUNTS along with PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permissions.

        Parameters:
        userAccount - The desired user account for which to delete the corresponding Android Account.
        Returns:
        True if the account has been deleted, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        deleteAccountAsync(UserAccount), createAccount(UserAccount), AccountManager.removeAccount(Account, AccountManagerCallback, Handler), AccountManager.invalidateAuthToken(String, String)

      • onDeleteAccount

        protected boolean onDeleteAccount(@NonNull
                                  A userAccount)
        Invoked whenever createAccount(UserAccount) or createAccountAsync(UserAccount) is called to create new Android Account.

        Note, that this method can be invoked on a background thread.

        Current implementation returns true whenever there has been found Android account to be deleted for the given user account, false otherwise.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_GET_ACCOUNTS along with PERMISSION_AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS permissions.

        Parameters:
        userAccount - The desired user account for which to delete the corresponding Android Account.
        Returns:
        True if account has been deleted, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        onCreateAccount(UserAccount)

      • findAccountForUser

        @Nullable
protected Account findAccountForUser(@NonNull
                                                A userAccount)
        Called to find the Android Account associated with the given userAccount.

        Default implementation retrieves all current accounts by the account type specified for this manager and searches for one that has same name specified as the given user account. See UserAccount.getName() and Account.name for additional information.

        This method requires the caller to hold PERMISSION_GET_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        userAccount - The user account for which to find the corresponding Android account.
        Returns:
        Android account that has been previously created for the given user account or null if there is no account created for the requested user account.
